thread.title: Patriots break out cheap champagne to celebrate Super Bowl win
thread.title_full: Patriots break out cheap champagne to celebrate Super Bowl win

author: Martin Rogers
title: Patriots break out cheap champagne to celebrate Super Bowl win

organizations.name: usa today sports linebacker laroy reynolds

text:

Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2kdvguf Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Patriots break out cheap champagne to celebrate Super Bowl win Martin Rogers , USA TODAY Sports 7:29 a.m. ET Feb. 6, 2017 CLOSE x Share USA TODAY Sports' Lindsay Jones breaks down how the Patriots managed to pull off a comeback for the ages in Super Bowl LI. USA TODAY Sports Patriots owner Robert Kraft hands out cigars in the locker room. (Photo: Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports) 
HOUSTON – The New England Patriots started discussing ways to celebrate their dramatic Super Bowl LI triumph in style almost as soon as they left the field at NRG Stadium after sinking the Atlanta Falcons in overtime. 
There were big plans, talk of expensive shots, fancy clubs, off-season trips, a bottle of scotch being passed around, and then owner Robert Kraft started handing out Cuban cigars. 
But perhaps the most dramatic part of the early festivities was decidedly low-budget, as defensive end Chris Long busted out several bottles of cheap champagne and handed them out for the defensive line to spray each other and surrounding staffers and members of the media. 
“I got them from Walgreens,” Long said. “For a while there during the game I was thinking maybe I shouldn’t have gotten it. Now I’m glad I did.” 
MORE SUPER BOWL: Tom Brady suspects Super Bowl jersey was stolen after game 
The drink of choice was Andre champagne, which sits at the cheaper end of the spectrum compared to the choices the Patriots were likely presented with at their lavish team party later. 
“There is going to be a big party,” Patrick Chung said. “The way I feel right now, it could last for a week. That is the best part, you get to celebrate with all your brothers and your family.” Chung was one of several players to enjoy a swig from a bottle of Battle Cry whiskey that was being passed around. “It might be a long time before we go to sleep,” he added. 
The biggest cheer was reserved for the emergence of Kraft, who brought with him a huge cigar box and shared them around. 
“This is a Super Bowl championship cigar,” defensive tackle Alan Branch said. “It feels pretty sweet to get one of these from the owner. That shows the kind of guy he is. If we lose, we lose together. When we win, we all share in it.” PHOTOS: Best of Super Bowl LI Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Tom Brady hoists the Lombardi Trophy after the Patriots beat the Falcons to win Super Bowl LI. Brady and New England won 34-28 in the first-ever Super Bowl to go to overtime. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots quarterback Tom Brady hoists the Lombardi Trophy for the fifth time, most of any quarterback ever. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Winning the Super Bowl appears to be one of the rare things that can get Patriots head coach Bill Belichick to crack a smile. Daniel Powers, USA TODAY Sports Patriots owner Robert Kraft hoists the Lombardi Trophy. Mark J.
